body.name: MSI PRO A620M-E ProSeries Motherboard (AMD AM5, DDR5, PCIe 4.0, SATA 6Gb/s, M.2, USB 3.2 Gen 1, Gbps LAN, DVI/HDMI, mATX)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by InfinityProduct.
features: Supports AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Desktop Processors
Supports DDR5 Memory, Dual Channel DDR5 6400+MHz (OC)
Core Boost : With premium layout and digital power design to support more cores and provide better performance
Memory Boost: Advanced technology to deliver pure data signals for the best performance, stability and compatibility
Lightning Fast Game experience: PCIe 4.0 slots, Lightning Gen 4 x4 M.2
body.description: The PRO Series is tailored to professionals from all walks of life. The lineup features impressive performance and high quality, while aiming to provide users incredible experience. Users who care about productivity and efficiency can definitely count on the MSI PRO Series to assist you with multitasking and increasing efficiency.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.0 4.0 out of 5 stars 44 ratings 4.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works like a champ
reviews.reviewText: I used this to build a back up gaming PC for when I’m visiting my mom. I put in some new parts and some old parts and it handles them all fine. All the devices are supported under Linux and don’t have any quirks that I’ve been able to uncover.I used:Ryzen 7700xGskill DDR5 high speed gaming memorySoldigm NVMe SSDNvidia 2080Ti FE

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good cheap board, but you get what you pay for in system testing
reviews.reviewText: Now that I've got it to POST, it works fine, does what I need it to. However, getting it to POST was the problem.The RAM slots (only two), are EXTREMELY tight, and use only one latch on the top. I had a hard time getting them in at all, and when I heard a click I assumed they were good. However, the side without a latch wasn't in all the way.Check especially carefully the RAM slots if you have a solid RED CPU diagnostic light and solid YELLOW DRAM light, at least, that was my issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Ram slot issues
reviews.reviewText: Im not the type to write reviews but i feel like everyone tht wna buy this cheap ahh motherboard shld know tht ur prob gna run into an issue with one of the ram slots not functioning and reading the ram module. So save yo time and money and dont take the risk of building your pc jus to take it apart and ship this weak ahh motherboard back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars There is so much wrong with this board
reviews.reviewText: So one of the things I knew better to do was to skimp out on a motherboard. I was building a PC within my girls budget so I gave it a shot. There is just so many things about this board that is bad. For 1, the bios did not recognize my mice or keyboards. I say that plural because i tried 3 of each in multiple different usb ports. After some research I read alot of msi boards still need to resort to PS/2 technology in their bios which is tech I haven't seen used in over a decade. So i was unable to use the XMP profile on the ram without ordering ps/2 to USB adapters. Problem number 2, it has no wifi. No big deal, ill add a PCI-e x1 wifi card. Actually, you cant because a 2 slot GPU covers the slot. Problem number 3, A case front USB 19 pin header interferes with GPU fans because your X16 slot is so low on the motherboard. The fan was rubbing on the wire and i had to jam a 12mm socket between my GPU and my bottom mounted power supply to try to force clearance of that wire which only kinda worked. Basically this motherboard resulted in my needing to do several returns to amazon due to the poor design. I returned the motherboard, the pci-e wifi card, and a GPU support bracket because it didn't solve the rubbing on wire issue. At the end of the day, i spent the same amount of money of all 3 items on a different board that solved every problem i had. The gpu slot was higher up on the board, the x1 port was not covered by gpu, there is no fan rubbing anymore and it came with alot more luxuries than this board did. Do yourself a favor and save yourself from a headache and double your budget for the motherboard so youre not tearing your new pc apart to gut the motherboard out and then having to rebuild it again because you skimped out. If your building a pc with integrated graphics just for schoolwork or something , sure this motherboard will do that ok.

Se desempeña muy bien, es una buena tarjeta de actualización si ya tienes todos tus periféricos externos, incluido wifi. Es muy lenta en el arranque y el BIOS para mi gusto no es de lo mejor por eso le pongo 4 estrellas. Aún así si la recomiendo.
The motherboard does the job and has enough headers for 2 sys fans. It did take quite a while to post, almost lost patience from how long.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For only 95 pounds it's a steal but be sure to update the bios to the latest version as the boot times were horrendous out of the box. Don't worry about the lack of overclocking support because my Ryzen 5 7600 ran at 5ghz out the box.

reviews.reviewTitle: No me inicia rápido el BIOS
reviews.reviewText: Tarda en iniciar ,buen procesador y buena ram con un m.2Pero inciia 🦥 lento
Only one small con the usb3 header is facing outwards, not a big dealHaving a DOA mobo is though
